title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {jot: Jot Down Values for Later},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2022},   note = {http://christophertkenny.com/jot/, https://github.com/christopherkenny/jot}, }

title: Jot Down Values for Later
text: goal jot improve reproducability allowing track statistics needed Rmd big open. statistics require summarizing large datasets take long time calculate. jot approaches following organizing principles: 1. Notes lockable, tests don’t accidentally overwrite existing statistics. 2. want know statistic last updated. 3. collaborative projects, want know last updated statistic. 4. Records play well GitHub, done representing notes yaml.

title: Jot Down Values for Later
text: can install development version jot like :

title: Jot Down Values for Later
text: normal workflow jot two staged, first creating notes second reading .

title: Jot Down Values for Later
text: First, make notepad, giving location title. contents new pad look like: creating new notepad, set active notepad. active notepad represented path. write notepad can use jot(): default, writes active notepad, now: , notepad still say: can fix explicitly overwriting. gives us: can add values long different name: can even add fancier things like data.frames, limited small things! goal jot store summaries statistics, data. ’re happy notes, lock notepad. sets locked value TRUE (yes yaml).
code: library(jot)  path <- tempfile(fileext = '.yaml')  jot_new_pad(pad = path, title = 'example') title: example locked: FALSE home: the_path.yaml jot_active() #> [1] "C:\\Users\\chris\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpAFuA8J\\file2cfc4cc14957.yaml" jot(note = 3, name = 'estimate') title: example locked: no home: the\path.yaml estimate:   last_update: 1659545779   user: chris   content: 3.0   quoted: no jot(note = 4, name = 'estimate') #> Warning: `name` already exists and `overwrite` is "FALSE". No updates were made. title: example locked: no home: the\path.yaml estimate:   last_update: 1659545779   user: chris   content: 3.0   quoted: no jot(note = 4, name = 'estimate', overwrite = TRUE) title: example locked: no home: the\path.yaml estimate:   last_update: 1659545993   user: chris   content: 4.0   quoted: no jot(note = list(a = 1, b = 2, c = 3), name = 'list_abc', overwrite = TRUE) jot(data.frame(col1 = 1, col2 = 2, col3 = 3), 'df') jot_lock() title: example locked: yes home: the\path.yaml estimate:   last_update: 1659545993   user: chris   content: 4.0   quoted: no list_abc:   last_update: 1659546469   user: chris   content:     a: 1.0     b: 2.0     c: 3.0   quoted: no

title: Jot Down Values for Later
text: setup chunk Rmd, add: , use temp path writing , generally something within project. Now, can read values. can skim note report back everything: , can select specific element ’ve stored. returns object type inputted, list_abc list:
code: library(jot) jot_activate(pad = path) jot_skim() #> $estimate #> [1] 4 #>  #> $list_abc #> $list_abc$a #> [1] 1 #>  #> $list_abc$b #> [1] 2 #>  #> $list_abc$c #> [1] 3 #>  #>  #> $df #>   col1 col2 col3 #> 1    1    2    3 jot_read(name = 'estimate') #> [1] 4 jot_read(name = 'list_abc') #> $a #> [1] 1 #>  #> $b #> [1] 2 #>  #> $c #> [1] 3

title: Get Current User — get_jot_user
text: user user override get . Default '', checks options, system info.

what: Get System Time as Integer — get_sys_time
title: Get System Time as Integer — get_sys_time
Get System Time as Integer — get_sys_time
Get System Time as Integer — get_sys_time
Get System Time as Integer — get_sys_time
Jot Down a Note — jot
code: jot(   note,   name,   overwrite = FALSE,   user = get_jot_user(),   time = get_sys_time(),   pad = jot_active() )  write_jot(   note,   name,   overwrite = FALSE,   user = get_jot_user(),   time = get_sys_time(),   pad = jot_active() )

title: Jot Down a Note — jot
text: note data save. required. name character, name data. required. overwrite logical, default FALSE. note name exists, overwritten? user name user. default get_jot_user(). time system time. default get_sys_time(). pad path file pad write . default jot_active().

title: Erase a Note — jot_erase
text: name character, name note erase. required. pad path file pad write . default jot_active().

what: List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
title: List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
List out names of values in a jot notepad — jot_list
code: tf <- tempfile() jot_new_pad(tf) jot_activate(tf) jot('ex_val', 'ex') jot_list() #> [1] "ex"

what: Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
title: Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
text: jot_lock() locks notepad jot write . jot_unlock() unlocks notepad jot can write .

title: Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
Lock or Unlock a jot Notepad — jot_lock
code: tf <- tempfile() jot_new_pad(tf) jot_activate(tf) jot_lock() jot_unlock()

title: Create new jot Notepad — jot_new_pad
text: pad path file store new notepad. title call notepad. supplied, uses name file.

what: Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
title: Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
text: jot_open() jot_activate() opens existing notepad sets active. jot_current() jot_active() return path current notepad. jot_close() jot_deactivate() closes open notepad, one.

title: Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
code: jot_open(pad)  jot_activate(pad)  jot_active()  jot_current()  jot_close()  jot_deactivate()

title: Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
Open and Close jot Notepads — jot_open
code: tf <- tempfile() jot_new_pad(tf) jot_open(tf) jot_active() #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOp4SfP/file294f2c8b3b68.yaml" jot_current() #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOp4SfP/file294f2c8b3b68.yaml" jot_close() jot_active() #> [1] ""

title: Read a jot notepad — jot_read
code: jot_read(name, pad = jot_active())  read_jot(name, pad = jot_active())

title: Read a jot notepad — jot_read
text: name name noteto read pad path file open

title: Read a jot notepad — jot_read
code: tf <- tempfile() jot_new_pad(tf) jot_activate(tf) jot(note = 'ex_note', name = 'ex_name') jot_read() #> $ex_name #> [1] "ex_note" #>  jot_read('ex_name') #> [1] "ex_note"

what: Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
title: Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
Read in all values from a jot notepad — jot_skim
code: tf <- tempfile() jot_new_pad(tf) jot_activate(tf) jot('ex_val', 'ex') jot_skim() #> $ex #> [1] "ex_val" #>
